critique: This document authorizes the enlistment of Filipinos into the US Navy with specific pay rates. It seems to be an administrative order related to military personnel. Ideologically, it doesn't strongly lean in either direction (Liberal/Conservative). It has a slight impact on immigration as it allows Filipinos to enlist, but it's not a broad immigration policy. It could be argued that establishing a specific unit expands executive power, but it's more of an administrative detail. It centralizes control within the federal government (Federalism). It has a slight national security focus by bolstering the Navy. It doesn't directly regulate the economy, but it does set wages for these positions. It's somewhat inclusive by allowing Filipinos to serve, but the pay disparities might suggest otherwise.
